content.description: Moderate start to a section that will sting you.  Thin tricky face climbing.
content.location: Second from left on the pillar at right end of the crag.

content.description: Tricky start to easier climbing above on an arete
content.location: Right edge of semi-detached pillar on the right end of the cliff band.

content.description: A knee bar makes the first clip easy and protects the first hard section.  The rest of the climb is pretty moderate and leads to a fun right arching layback section through the final bulge.
content.location: Start at the right edge of a small roof band that is about 8 feet off the ground

content.description: Hard start over a roof to a little less demanding moves through bulges.
content.location: Climbs through the middle of a small roof band that is about 8 feet above the ground.

content.description:
fallout.wikia.com/wiki/Radsâ€¦

  This climb is moderate until it gets hard and has been rated from 11 to 12-.  Marginal underclings and footwork intensive moves off an index finger stack (sort of) lead to a jug but it stays with you after that.  We originally thought this was harder than the route to the left.  But after trying to repeat the route to the left I think I will raise the grade on it.  Look forward to seeing what concensus ends up being.
content.location: Third from left on the pillar/buttress at right end of the wall.

content.description: A couple of sections will get your attention on this sustained route.  Edging skills will serve you well.
content.location: Second route right of a crack/weakness.  First bolt is pretty close to the ground.

content.description: Heavily bolted face climbing on good edges on steep rock.
content.location: On main face starting below a short left facing corner about 15 feet up the wall.

content.description: Overhanging arete/buttress vaguely reminiscent of Steve's Arete.  A section of opposition moves reminds one of hugging your middle aged aunt.  You are happy to hug her but you realize this is a different body than the one in the photos of her on the mantel.  You can also pull all the way around to the left if you like crack climbing.
content.location: Left side of semi-detached pillar at right end of cliff band.

content.description: This route is all about edging and thin crimps.  Pretty fun stuff.
content.location: Starts just right of small ledge 8 feet off the ground with shin daggers growing on it.

content.description: Steep start to fun but easier climbing.
content.location: Just right of crack/weakness is a short, ragged looking, left facing corner.

content.description: Interesting climbing that angles up and right roughly following a groove and turning a number of bulges.
content.location: Starts at the left end of a small roof band that is about 8 feet off the ground.

content.description: A couple of thin sections and a balance move to finish it off.
content.location: Starts just left of a ledge that is eight feet above the ground and has shindaggers on it.

content.description: Interesting edging and thoughtful route finding on vertical rock.
content.location: Middle of face. Climb just left of the shallow right facing weakness.

content.description:
This cliff somehow became a small area with more routes than we expected.  Faces west so it is shady in the morning and sunny in the afternoon.  The rock is a Banded Gneiss with a bit of patina that begs the belayer to wear a helmet.  Fun edging on routes from 40 to 80 feet long.  At the south end is a leaning pillar where those looking for a little more sting will find it.  As usual with these newer areas the rock leaves a little to be desired but it is mostly small stuff that will clean up with the passage of climbers.  Occasionally your quickdraw will bang against the wall and give off a hollow sound as if it is in bad rock.  It isn't in bad rock.  The bolt is in good stuff but the rock below might have a little veneer that could give you pause but the bolts are in good stuff. 

  The first routes were put up in a pretty stiff breeze and when a loose flake was removed a number of bark scorpions were lifted up towards Jimbo as he hung from the top-rope.  You should have seen him trying to avoid a collision.
